title: Ticket #7123: Remove std uni checks from start expression when no std uni in startd
description:
Today, the startd unconditionally &&'s in a clause to the Requirements expression IsValidCheckpoint, which checks if the target job is standard universe, and if so, that the platform of any previous checkpoints the job has made matches this platform.

As we remove standard universe, more and more startds don't support standard universe at all. The startd knows if it has a standard universe starter. Let's remove this check from start if the start has no standard universe.

Doing so simplifies the start'd requirements expressions, removes a couple of significant attributes and makes matchmaking faster in the increasingly common case where a startd doesn't support standard universe.
